intro.title: COVID-19 in ICE Detention
intro.subtitle: UCLA Law
intro.body: Our immigration detention research team collects data on the number of people detained by U.S. Immigrations and Customs Enforcement (ICE) across the country who have been infected with or died from COVID. Our data come directly from ICEâ€™s website and are updated several times per week.

map.title: Showing ${metric}
map.description: This map displays COVID-19 cases and related deaths of people detained by ICE in facilities across the US, as well as the boundaries for the 24 ICE Enforcement & Removal Operations Field Office regions.

labels.confirmed: Each spike represents the number of detained people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
labels.confirmed_rate: Each spike represents the % of detained people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
labels.deaths: Each spike represents the number of detained people who have died due to COVID-19 within a facility
labels.deaths_rate: Each spike represents the % of detained people who have died due to COVID-19 in a facility
labels.active: Each spike represents the number detained people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
labels.active_rate: Each spike represents the % of detained people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
labels.tested: Each spike represents the number of incarcerated people who have been tested for COVID-19 within a facility
labels.tested_rate: Each spike represents the % of incarcerated people who have been tested for COVID-19 within a facility

map.notes: This map displays COVID-19 cases and related deaths of people detained by ICE in facilities across the US, as well as the boundaries for the 24 ICE Enforcement & Removal Operations Field Office regions.

table.title: Facilities with the highest ${metric}
note: Actual COVID case counts are likely much higher than reported by ICE, as testing by the agency has been limited.
Rates are calculated using a denominator of average facility-level population for 2020. Populations have decreased significantly over the course of the pandemic.

scorecard.title: Data Reporting & Quality Scorecard
scorecard.description: This scorecard assesses data reporting and quality for ICE. Read more about our scoring methodology and to see how this jurisdiction compares to other state and federal systems.

asterisk_notes.note: We have observed several unexplained fluctuations in the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases and tests that ICE reports.
